Job Title: Corporate Credit Manager

Location: Roswell, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job Summary

The basic function of the Corporate Credit Manager is to help maintain/improve cash flow and working capital within the business. This position is responsible for establishing sound credit policies and procedures and administer all credit operations of the company in a manner that will increase sales volume, contribute to the profit of the company, and enhance customer stability, and provide for the prompt turnover and adequate protection of the company’s investment in accounts receivable.

Job Responsibilities

Manages a team within the credit organizationResponsible for credit management processes for credit organization including functions that may be outsourced to a 3rd partyManages the KMC accounts receivable portfolio. This includes identifying key risks in the portfolio and developing a plan for mitigation, establishing appropriate allowance for doubtful accounts, and approving all bad-debt write-offsWorks closely with 3rd party providers to provide support and escalation routes to ensure that service levels are being achievedSupport credit organization in managing a portfolio of key accounts which may require customer / site visitsSupport Credit Management to resolve queries and work efficiently to analyze root cause issues and implement actions to prevent future occurrenceWork with Director of Credit to create an accurate weekly / monthly cash flow forecastWork closely with the commercial teams, including Directors and Regional Managers to ensure the customer experience is optimalPrepare various management reports as neededWork closely with the credit insurers, when requiredPropose companywide credit policies for top management approval and establishes general policies, procedures, and practices governing overall credit operationsResponsible for establishing trade receivables goals with management, judicious granting of credit, and maintaining efficient collection practices for the overall company - this includes minimizing bad debt losses for the CompanyResponsible for establishing best practices for the credit management groupParticipates with senior management and others in periodic analyses of the market, economy, industry, and business conditions affecting the company’s credit policiesKeeps corporate management informed concerning the status of the accounts receivable portfolio, the forecasts of cash inflows, the expenses in administering the department, and any special purpose activitiesOther duties, as assigned


Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance or equivalent business experience8+ years experience in operational credit managementExperience in successfully leading a credit organizationProven ability to perform well under pressure and in a high-volume and changing environmentStrong experience with Construction Credit (Mechanic Liens and /or Bonds)Expertise in Sales Tax Exemption Certificates and Audits


Other Skills And Abilities

Strong ability to analyze financials and related public filings like 10Q and 10K reportsCritical attention to timing and due dates or deadlinesStrong internal and external communication skillsEffective leadership and management of teams

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
